definitions: feeling stressed and overburdened from being rushed with too many demands
troubled persistently by repeated attacks or persistent difficulties
examples: The harried mother juggled three crying children
Harried executives rushed between back-to-back meetings
The harried troops retreated under constant enemy fire
Harried wildlife fled the advancing wildfire

definitions: causing extreme distress, anguish, or emotional suffering through intensity or horror
examples: The harrowing documentary showed victims of war
She shared her harrowing experience of surviving the accident

definitions: unpleasantly rough or jarring to the senses, lacking gentleness
cruel or severe in judgment, punishment, or treatment of others
difficult to survive in or endure due to extreme conditions
examples: The harsh light hurt her sensitive eyes
His harsh voice grated on everyone's nerves
The judge delivered a harsh sentence for the crime
Her harsh criticism destroyed his confidence
The harsh winter killed many of the plants
Harsh economic conditions forced businesses to close

definitions: done or made too quickly without proper care or thought
showing excessive eagerness or impatience in manner or movement
examples: His hasty decision to quit proved costly
They made a hasty retreat when danger appeared
She gave a hasty goodbye before running out
His hasty temper often got him into trouble

definitions: marked with fine parallel lines for shading or texture
having emerged from an egg through breaking the shell
examples: The hatched pattern on the drawing added depth
Cross-hatched areas indicated shadows on the map
The newly hatched chicks huddled together for warmth
Recently hatched sea turtles headed toward the ocean

definitions: regarded with intense dislike, hostility, or strong aversion by others
examples: The hated dictator finally lost power after decades
She became the most hated person in town

definitions: arousing or deserving intense dislike, extremely unpleasant or offensive
showing or feeling intense dislike or ill will toward others
examples: His hateful remarks offended everyone in the room
The hateful crime shocked the entire community
She gave him a hateful look before leaving
His hateful attitude poisoned every interaction

definitions: showing arrogant superiority and disdain toward others deemed inferior
examples: Her haughty manner alienated potential friends
The haughty aristocrat refused to acknowledge the servants

definitions: inhabited or frequented by ghosts or supernatural beings
showing signs of mental distress from disturbing memories or experiences
examples: The haunted house attracted thrill-seekers every Halloween
Local legends claimed the cemetery was haunted
His haunted eyes revealed years of suffering
She had a haunted expression after the tragedy

definitions: remaining persistently in the mind, difficult to forget or ignore
evoking a feeling of sadness, longing, or wistful beauty
examples: The haunting melody stayed with her for days
His haunting words echoed in her thoughts
The painting had a haunting beauty that moved viewers
Her haunting voice filled the empty cathedral

definitions: out of control, functioning erratically or in complete disorder
examples: The computer system went completely haywire yesterday
Everything went haywire when the power failed

definitions: involving or exposing one to risk of harm, loss, or danger
examples: Hazardous chemicals require special handling procedures
The hazardous journey through the mountains claimed lives

definitions: of a light greenish-brown or yellowish-brown color like hazelnuts
examples: Her beautiful hazel eyes changed color in different light
The cat had striking hazel eyes

definitions: obscured by haze, mist, or smoke; lacking clarity
vague, indistinct, or unclear in outline or understanding
examples: The hazy summer sky threatened afternoon thunderstorms
Distant mountains appeared hazy in the morning light
She had only hazy memories of her childhood
His hazy understanding of physics showed in his answers

definitions: having a head or heading of a specified kind
moving or directed toward a particular destination or outcome
examples: The official letter was on headed paper
A two-headed snake was displayed at the museum
The ship was headed for tropical waters
They seemed headed for divorce

definitions: lacking a head or having had the head removed
lacking leadership, direction, or someone in charge
examples: The headless statue stood in the ancient ruins
A headless horseman appeared in the ghost story
The headless organization struggled without clear direction
The team remained headless after their captain quit

definitions: with the head leading; in a rush forward with head first
done rashly without thought or caution; recklessly impetuous
examples: He fell headlong down the stairs
She dived headlong into the swimming pool
They rushed headlong into marriage without thinking
The army's headlong retreat turned into chaos

definitions: stubbornly following one's own will despite advice or reason
examples: The headstrong teenager ignored all parental advice
Her headstrong nature often led to poor decisions

definitions: having an intoxicating effect on the senses or mind
exciting and making one feel exhilarated with success or power
examples: The heady perfume filled the entire room
The heady wine went straight to her head
The heady days of early success soon ended
She enjoyed the heady atmosphere of opening night

definitions: restored to health or soundness after injury, illness, or damage
examples: The healed wound left only a faint scar
His healed broken leg was stronger than before

definitions: having the power to cure, restore health, or promote recovery
examples: The healing properties of certain herbs are well-documented
She found the mountain air had healing qualities

definitions: conducive to good health; having properties that promote wellness
examples: She maintained a healthful diet rich in vegetables
The spa offered various healthful treatments and activities

definitions: in better health or more conducive to good health than something else
examples: She felt healthier after changing her diet
Fresh vegetables are healthier than processed foods

definitions: being in a state of good physical and mental health
conducive to or promoting good health and well-being
showing physical, mental, or economic vitality and vigor
examples: The healthy children played energetically in the yard
She maintained a healthy weight through regular exercise
They served healthy meals at the school cafeteria
Swimming is a healthy form of exercise
The company reported healthy profits last quarter
She has a healthy respect for dangerous animals

definitions: perceived through the sense of hearing at some point
given attention or consideration through listening
examples: The heard testimony influenced the jury's decision
Previously heard songs played on the radio
Their heard complaints finally received a response
All heard witnesses agreed on the facts

definitions: having the ability to perceive sound through the ears
relating to or used in the process of perceiving sound
examples: Hearing people often take their ability for granted
The hearing child helped interpret for deaf parents
She needed hearing aids to improve her perception
The doctor performed various hearing tests

definitions: based on what others have said rather than direct knowledge
examples: The judge rejected the hearsay evidence in court
His hearsay account proved completely unreliable

definitions: causing overwhelming sadness, grief, or emotional pain
examples: The heartbreaking story moved everyone to tears
It was heartbreaking to see such suffering

definitions: suffering from overwhelming grief, sorrow, or disappointment
examples: She was heartbroken when her relationship ended
The heartbroken parents mourned their loss

definitions: deeply and sincerely felt or expressed from genuine emotion
examples: She offered her heartfelt condolences to the family
His heartfelt apology finally mended their friendship

definitions: completely lacking in feeling, compassion, or human kindness
examples: The heartless criminal showed no remorse for victims
Her heartless remarks wounded him deeply

definitions: causing feelings of happiness, pleasure, and emotional warmth
examples: The heartwarming reunion brought tears of joy
It's heartwarming to see such community support

definitions: showing warm, enthusiastic friendliness and genuine good cheer
substantial, nourishing, and satisfying, especially of food
physically strong, vigorous, and in robust good health
examples: He gave them a hearty welcome at the door
Her hearty laughter filled the entire room
They enjoyed a hearty breakfast before the hike
The restaurant serves hearty portions of comfort food
The hearty farmers worked from dawn until dusk
Despite his age, he remained hearty and active

definitions: made warm or hot by applying heat or energy
marked by strong emotions, anger, or passionate disagreement
examples: The heated pool was perfect for winter swimming
She warmed herself by the heated stove
Their heated argument could be heard next door
The heated debate lasted for three hours

definitions: relating to religions other than Christianity, Judaism, or Islam
regarded as lacking culture, religion, or moral principles
examples: Ancient heathen rituals fascinated the archaeologists
The missionaries sought to convert heathen peoples
He jokingly called his messy roommates heathens
Their heathen behavior shocked the conservative community

definitions: relating to or coming from heaven or the divine realm
wonderfully pleasant, beautiful, or delightful to experience
examples: Angels are heavenly beings in many religions
The choir sang heavenly music in the cathedral
The heavenly aroma of fresh bread filled the bakery
This chocolate cake tastes absolutely heavenly

definitions: having great weight that is difficult to lift or move
dense, thick, or substantial in consistency or appearance
serious, difficult to bear, or oppressive in nature
great in amount, degree, or intensity beyond normal
examples: The heavy box required two people to lift
Her heavy suitcase exceeded the airline limit
Heavy fog reduced visibility to near zero
She wore a heavy wool coat against the cold
The news lay heavy on everyone's hearts
Heavy responsibilities weighed on his shoulders
Heavy rain flooded the streets within minutes
The heavy traffic made her late for work

definitions: full of incessant or frantic activity, very busy and fast-paced
examples: Her hectic schedule left no time for relaxation
The hectic pace of city life exhausted him

definitions: devoted to the pursuit of pleasure and self-gratification above all else
examples: His hedonistic lifestyle eventually caught up with him
The hedonistic party culture dominated campus life

definitions: large, heavy, or substantial in size, weight, or amount
examples: He paid a hefty price for the vintage car
The hefty textbook weighed several pounds

definitions: making or becoming more intense, acute, or prominent
examples: The heightening tension made everyone nervous
Her heightening awareness revealed hidden details

definitions: utterly odious, wicked, or evil; deserving strong condemnation
examples: The heinous crime shocked the entire nation
Such heinous acts cannot go unpunished

definitions: grasped, supported, or kept in position by someone or something
organized, conducted, or taking place at a specific time
maintained or possessed as a belief, opinion, or position
examples: The held prisoner awaited trial for months
Tightly held secrets eventually came to light
The held conference attracted international speakers
Recently held elections changed the government
His long-held beliefs were finally challenged
Widely held opinions shaped public policy

definitions: having the shape or form of a helix or spiral
examples: DNA has a distinctive helical structure
The helical staircase wound up the tower

definitions: having or representing the sun as the center of the solar system
examples: Copernicus proposed the heliocentric model of our solar system
The heliocentric theory revolutionized astronomy

definitions: resembling or characteristic of hell in appearance or nature
extremely unpleasant, difficult, or unbearable to experience
examples: The hellish landscape of the volcano scared visitors
Hellish flames consumed the entire building
She endured a hellish commute every morning
The hellish heat made work nearly impossible

definitions: wearing or protected by a helmet on the head
examples: The helmeted riders raced down the mountain trail
Helmeted workers entered the construction site

definitions: giving or ready to give help, useful assistance, or service
examples: The helpful staff answered all our questions
Your helpful suggestions improved the project significantly

definitions: unable to defend oneself or act without help from others
lacking control or ability to change a difficult situation
examples: The helpless baby depended entirely on its parents
Helpless victims waited for rescue teams
She felt helpless watching the disaster unfold
They were helpless to prevent the company's collapse

definitions: relating to or affecting half of a sphere, especially the brain or Earth
examples: Hemispheric differences in brain function fascinate neuroscientists
The conference addressed hemispheric trade agreements
